item.title: 7 Vulnerable Applications for Practicing Pentesting
item.description: The best way to learn security concepts is by doing it. But how to do it if you don’t know it? These vulnerable apps will make you learn and do it! 1. DVWA Damn Vulnerable Web App (DVWA) is a PHP/MySQL web application that is damn vulnerable.

item.title: How to Verify News on Social Media
item.description: The narcissist photos and posts on Facebook do not bother me anymore. What does bother me is that people spread fake news and some idiots believe them. And at times I have been unlucky to be on the “idiot” side of things.

item.title: Why Even Noobs Should Participate in CTFs
item.description: A few days back Facebook held their first-ever CTF and Google also held theirs a few days later. Although I occasionally goof around with CTFs, I’m no expert at it. Despite this, I decided to take an attempt.

item.title: Kali as a Regular Operating System
item.description: If you are an aspiring pentester you should definitely use Kali Linux and make it your primary OS. Switching to a new OS can be a very hard decision to make. Concerns such as whether you can do your regular work may rise.

item.title: How to be a Hacker with Kali

item.title: 5 Reasons Why Linux Needs No Antivirus
item.description: So, maybe you have heard Linux PCs are super safe because they are not affected by viruses. Linux computers are almost immune to viruses. Yes, I said “almost” immune. But the percentage of PCs being affected is very less, even less than 1%.
